HTMLTemplateElement.summary: The HTMLTemplateElement interface enables access to the contents of an HTML template element.

blockquote.para:
An HTML parser can create either an HTMLTemplateElement or a when it parses a {{HTMLElement("template")}} element, depending on the <template> attributes.
If an HTMLTemplateElement is created the "shadow" attributes are reflected from the template.
However these are not useful, because an HTMLTemplateElement is not a shadow root and cannot subsequently be changed to a shadow root.

HTMLTemplateElementShadowRootMode.summary: The shadowRootMode property of the interface reflects the value of the shadowrootmode attribute of the associated <template> element.

remarks.para:
Note that this property is not useful for developers.
If a <template> element is used to declaratively create a ShadowRoot, then this object and property do not exist.
Otherwise, if an HTMLTemplateElement is created, the value of this property is irrelevant because the object is not a shadow root and cannot subsequently be changed to a shadow root.

HTMLTemplateElementShadowRootMode.value: Reflects the value of the shadowrootmode attribute of the associated <template> element.

HTMLTemplateElementShadowRootDelegatesFo.summary: The shadowRootDelegatesFocus property of the interface reflects the value of the shadowrootdelegatesfocus attribute of the associated <template> element.

remarks.para:
Note that this property is not useful for developers.

HTMLTemplateElementShadowRootDelegatesFo.value: Reflects the value of the shadowrootdelegatesfocus attribute of the associated <template> element.

HTMLTemplateElementShadowRootClonable.value: Reflects the value of the shadowrootclonable attribute of the associated <template> element.
